tool.name: Find Clusters
tool.description: search for clusters(specific combination of patterns in a window size) on a genome
tool.help:
.. |INFO| image:: ../static/images/icon_info_sml.gif
-----
**Syntax**
This tool uses a combined method (suffix-header approach and database support) to find clusters of patterns.
-----
**The steps** are:
1. Select 'Genome' and click on 'Next step' button; 2. Select 'Available Chroms'(default: all); 2. or you can input positions. E.g. chr2L:110020-0. Note: 0 after '-' means 'end'. 3. Input 'Patterns': patterns and occurrences in cluster. Here is a simple example: ARWYAKGCAART,1,YRTGRGAR,2,TGGYAATTW,1,GCCSSRGGV,2, 4. Input 'window size' for the cluster; 5. Click on 'Execute' button to run the tool.
-----
**Example**
.. image:: ../static/patmat/findcluster.png
-----
**The outputs and display in ucsc genome browser**
1. The results are 3 files: 1)a bed format file of the clusters, 2)statistic file, 3)running log. 2. To display the bed format file of result clusters in genome browser, click on 'display at UCSC main'.
